title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Special Effects Artists and Animators

content.rendered:
What are Special Effects Artists and Animators?

Special Effects Artists and Animators design and bring to life images for many different forms of media on various mediums.

Where do Special Effects Artists and Animators work?

  • Animation companies
  • Independent film companies
  • Freelance work

How much do Special Effects Artists and Animators make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Special Effects Artists and Animators is $51,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Special Effects Artists and Animators?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Animation majors
  • Graphic design majors
  • Art majors
Search Special Effects Artist jobs on Handshake

Special Effects Artist and Animator skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Special Effects Artists and Animators succeed in their work:

  • Understanding of relevant animation softwares
  • Creativity skills
  • Arts training
  • Organization and ability to work under pressure

What are some common questions about Special Effects Artists and Animators?

Q: What should I list on my resume for a special effects job?

A: Besides a killer cover letter, it’s key to note that you have previous experience in animation and some knowledge of relevant software programs.
